Name: Head of Emperor Fasbasianos
Description: The head is from a colossal statue of Emperor Vespasian. The upper part is broken and missing. The Emperor Titus Flavius Vespasian (AD 69-79) was first proclaimed at Alexandria in AD July 69 by the Prefect Tiberius Julius Alexander.Here Vespasian is portrayed with his most well-known features and the nervous look that distinguishes his portraits. The face reflects the age of the emperor when he ruled the empire.
